com.skyhook.context

Class Accelerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skyhook.context.Accelerator

  • public final class Accelerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Context Accelerator provides in-depth user context to the application by leveraging highly curated persona and venue database combined with user location data.

    The following will guide you through integrating the SDK into your application.

    Add your API key

    The easiest way to declare the API key is to put it in the AndroidManifest.xml file: 
    
 <application ...>
     <meta-data android:name="com.skyhook.context.API_KEY"
                android:value="YOUR KEY"/>
     ...
 </application>

    Refer to setKey(String) for more details.

    Import the SDK

    Import the accelerator API: 
    
 import com.skyhook.context.Accelerator;

    Initialize the API

    Before making any Accelerator API calls you need to call the init(Context) first in your activity's onCreate method: 
    
 public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
     super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
     Accelerator.init(this);
     ...
 }

    Request location permission

    In order to be able to start campaign monitoring, your app must first obtain the ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION permission from the user: 
    
 public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
     super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
     Accelerator.init(this);
     ...
     ActivityCompat.requestPermissions(
         this, new String[] { Manifest.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION }, 0);
 }

    Start campaign monitoring

    Once the location permission has been granted, you can start monitoring campaigns using startMonitoringForAllCampaigns() or startMonitoringForCampaign(String): 
    
 public void onRequestPermissionsResult(
     final int requestCode, final String[] permissions, final int[] grantResults)
 {
     if (grantResults[0] == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED) {
         Accelerator.startMonitoringForAllCampaigns();
     }
 }

    Register for campaign monitoring events

    In order to get notified of campaign events during monitoring, you need to add a broadcast receiver to your application.

    Add the following line in your AndroidManifest.xml: 

    
     <uses-permission android:name="com.skyhook.context.RECEIVE_EVENT"/>

    Declare a receiver with the intent filter set to the ACCELERATOR_EVENT action: 

    
     <receiver android:name=".MyAcceleratorReceiver"
               android:exported="false">
         <intent-filter>
             <action android:name="com.skyhook.context.ACCELERATOR_EVENT"/>
         </intent-filter>
     </receiver>

    Implement the broadcast receiver to handle venue transitions: 

    
 public class MyAcceleratorReceiver extends BroadcastReceiver {
     public void onReceive(Context context, Intent intent) {
         if (Accelerator.hasError(intent)) {
             int errorCode = Accelerator.getErrorCode(intent));
             // handle error
         } else {
             CampaignVenue venue = Accelerator.getTriggeringCampaignVenue(intent);
             if (venue != null) {
                 int transition = Accelerator.getCampaignVenueTransition(intent);
                 // handle transition
             }
         }
     }
 }

    For more details on handling campaign events refer to the documentation of the following methods:

    • getTriggeringCampaignVenue(Intent)
    • getCampaignVenueTransition(Intent)
    • getErrorCode(Intent)

    Demographic Persona

    You can retrieve a fresh demographic persona for the current user using refreshPersona(): 
    
 Accelerator.refreshPersona()
            .setOnSuccessListener(new OnSuccessListener<Persona>() {
                public void onSuccess(Persona persona) {
                    // do something with persona
                }
            };
    Note that from the point monitoring has been first started on the device, it may take a while before the demographic persona is generated.

    If you just want to retrieve the persona cached during the last refresh call, use getLastPersona().

    Auxiliary methods

    • Fetch campaigns available for monitoring: getCampaigns()
    • Check campaign monitoring status: isMonitoringAllCampaigns()
    • Retrieve nearby venues at your location: getNearbyMonitoredVenues(int)
    • Get list of venues the user is currently inside: getCurrentVenues()
    • Retrieve full information about particular venues: getVenueInfo(List)
    • Determine IP-based location: requestIPLocation()
    • Opt in/out of usage information collection: setOptedIn(boolean)

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.content.Context context)
        Initializes the API.

        Must be called before calling other methods.

        A suitable place to call this method would be the onCreate method of your activity or application class.

        Parameters:
        context - Android context of the application.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if context is null.

      • setKey

        public static ITask<java.lang.Void> setKey(java.lang.String key)
        Sets the API key.

        This method can be called multiple times but it is sufficient to call it only once during the first launch of the application.

        Use this method only if you need to set the API key programmatically.

        For most applications it should be easier to define the API key in the AndroidManifest.xml file in a meta-data element under the application element: 

        
 <application ...>
     <meta-data android:name="com.skyhook.context.API_KEY"
                android:value="YOUR KEY"/>
        Parameters:
        key - API key obtained from My.Skyhook
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • startMonitoringForAllCampaigns

        public static ITask<java.lang.Void> startMonitoringForAllCampaigns()
        Starts monitoring for all campaigns that are active in the portal.

        If all campaigns are already being monitored, then this method has no effect.

        This method requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION. Note that starting from Android M (API level 23) the location permission must be requested at runtime.

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • stopMonitoringForAllCampaigns

        public static ITask<java.lang.Void> stopMonitoringForAllCampaigns()
        Stops monitoring for all campaigns.

        If no campaigns are currently being monitored, then this method has no effect.

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • startMonitoringForCampaign

        public static ITask<java.lang.Void> startMonitoringForCampaign(java.lang.String campaignName)
        Starts monitoring the specified campaign.

        This method is needed only in cases where fine control of the active campaigns is necessary, and in that case you must call it separately for each campaign you want to monitor. In most cases startMonitoringForAllCampaigns() should be used instead to enable monitoring for all campaigns that are active in the portal. The campaigns you add using this method can be accessed via getMonitoredCampaigns() method.

        If the specified campaign is currently being monitored, or if all campaigns are currently being monitored, then this method has no effect. If a campaign is specified which is not active on the portal, then it will be silently ignored.

        This method requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION. Note that starting from Android M (API level 23) the location permission must be requested at runtime.

        Parameters:
        campaignName - the name of the campaign to start monitoring.
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • stopMonitoringForCampaign

        public static ITask<java.lang.Void> stopMonitoringForCampaign(java.lang.String campaignName)
        Stops monitoring the specified campaign.

        If the specified campaign is not currently being monitored, then this method has no effect. Note that if all campaigns are being monitored, then calling this method has no effect. It will not stop the specified campaign from being monitored.

        Parameters:
        campaignName - the name of the campaign to stop monitoring.
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • isMonitoringAllCampaigns

        public static ITask<java.lang.Boolean> isMonitoringAllCampaigns()
        Determines whether all campaigns are currently being monitored or not.
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • getMonitoredCampaigns

        public static ITask<java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getMonitoredCampaigns()
        Retrieve the set of campaigns currently being monitored from calls to startMonitoringForCampaign(java.lang.String).

        This will return an empty set if no campaigns are being monitored. It will also return an empty set if isMonitoringAllCampaigns() is true.

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • refreshPersona

        public static ITask<Persona> refreshPersona()
        Refresh the Skyhook persona.

        This method requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION. Note that starting from Android M (API level 23) the location permission must be requested at runtime.

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.

        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • setOptedIn

        public static void setOptedIn(boolean optedIn)
        Set whether or not accelerator should collect usage information to continually improve the quality of the returned Skyhook personas. The SDK does not track individual users and completely anonymizes all collected information.

        Note that you might receive degraded personas if usage collection is disabled.

        If the value was not explicitly set, behavior is defined by Google Play Services: if Google Play Services are not installed on the device or the application doesn't use the Google Play Services library, or the "Opt out of interest-based ads" system setting is checked, accelerator will not collect usage information.

        Parameters:
        optedIn - true to enable usage collection and false to disable it.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • isOptedIn

        public static ITask<java.lang.Boolean> isOptedIn()
        Determines the opted in status which indicates whether or not accelerator should collect usage information.

        See setOptedIn(boolean)

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • setUserId

        public static void setUserId(java.lang.String userId)
        Set the unique user identifier for use to continually improve the quality of the Skyhook personas.

        Overrides Google advertising identifier.

        Must be 1..255 characters long, ASCII alphanumerical and any out of the !#$%&*+/=?^_`{|}~'@- characters are allowed. Invalid values are ignored.

        Parameters:
        userId - user identifier
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided user id is not valid.

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the Accelerator SDK version.
        Returns:
        a string containing the version information

      • getLastPersona

        public static ITask<Persona> getLastPersona()
        Get the last Skyhook persona.
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • getCurrentVenues

        public static ITask<java.util.Set<CampaignVenue>> getCurrentVenues()
        Get the set of venues that the user is currently inside for campaigns that are being monitored.

        Note that if campaign monitoring is currently stopped, then this will always return an empty set.

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • getNearbyMonitoredVenues

        public static ITask<java.util.List<NearbyCampaignVenue>> getNearbyMonitoredVenues(int limit)
        Get the list of venues nearby the current location for campaigns that are being monitored.

        Note that if campaign monitoring is currently stopped, then this will always pass back an empty list.

        This method requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION. Note that starting from Android M (API level 23) the location permission must be requested at runtime.

        Parameters:
        limit - maximum number of entries returned. The maximum value allowed for this is 100.
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • getVenueInfo

        public static ITask<java.util.List<VenueInfo>> getVenueInfo(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> ids)
        Get information for a list of venues.
        Parameters:
        ids - list of venue ids. At most only the first 100 entries will be used.
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • getVenueInfoAtLocation

        public static ITask<java.util.List<VenueInfo>> getVenueInfoAtLocation()
        Get information for the venues at the current location.

        This method will pass back the information for the venues at the current location even if those venues are not currently being monitored in any campaign. At most 10 venues will be passed back.

        If there is no recent location then a location will be calculated first before fetching the venue information.

        If this method is called while a previous call is already in progress, then that existing operation will be aborted and its callback will be invoked with an ERROR_OPERATION_ABORTED.

        This method requires ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION. Note that starting from Android M (API level 23) the location permission must be requested at runtime.

        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. The venues returned are ordered approximately from closest to farthest.

        See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • getCampaigns

        public static ITask<java.util.List<Campaign>> getCampaigns()
        Get the list of campaigns available on server.
        Returns:
        a Task for tracking the result. See AcceleratorStatusCodes for possible status codes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if init(Context) hasn't been called.

      • hasError

        public static boolean hasError(android.content.Intent intent)
        Whether an error triggered this intent.
        Parameters:
        intent - the intent generated for alert.
        Returns:
        true if an error triggered this intent otherwise false.

      • getErrorCode

        public static int getErrorCode(android.content.Intent intent)
        Returns the error code that explains the error that triggered this intent.
        Parameters:
        intent - the intent generated for alert.
        Returns:
        the error code specified in AcceleratorStatusCodes or -1 if hasError(Intent) returns false.

      • getCampaignVenueTransition

        public static int getCampaignVenueTransition(android.content.Intent intent)
        Returns the transition type of campaign venue transition alert.
        Parameters:
        intent - the intent generated for campaign venue alert.
        Returns:
        -1 if the intent is not generated for campaign venue alert. Otherwise returns the CAMPAIGN_VENUE_TRANSITION flags value defined in CampaignVenue.

      • getTriggeringCampaignVenue

        public static CampaignVenue getTriggeringCampaignVenue(android.content.Intent intent)
        Returns the campaign venue that triggers this transition alert.
        Parameters:
        intent - the intent generated for campaign venue alert.
        Returns:
        the campaign venue that triggers this transition alert or null if the given intent is not generated for campaign venue transition alert.
